mechanism_of_action.References: Osol, A. and J.E. Hoover, et al. (eds.). Remington's Pharmaceutical Sciences. 15th ed. Easton, Pennsylvania: Mack Publishing Co., 1975., p. 719
mechanism_of_action.Value: TANNIC ACID IN TEA ACCOUNTS FOR USE OF STRONG TEA IN UNIVERSAL ANTIDOTE, PRESUMABLY FOR DUAL PURPOSE OF PRECIPITATING TOXIC ALKALOIDS & OF HARDENING SURFACE OF GI MUCOSA & ITS MUCOUS LAYER.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 256
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: WHEN BURN-INDUCED ULCERS ON SKIN OF 20 WHITE RATS PAINTED DAILY WITH FRESH 5% AQ SOLN OF TANNIC ACID (USP), NO TUMORS WERE OBSERVED IN 11 ANIMALS SURVIVING 400 DAYS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 257
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: GROUP OF 30 MALE & 30 FEMALE YOUNG C3H/A MICE WAS INJECTED IM EVERY 2ND WK WITH 0.75 MG/KG BODY WT TANNIC ACID FOR 12 MO. ...ACID USED WAS NUT GALL TANNIC ACID... EXPT WAS TERMINATED AFTER 18 MO, 6 MO AFTER LAST INJECTION; NO LOCAL TUMORS WERE FOUND.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Grant, W. M. Toxicology of the Eye. 2nd ed. Springfield, Illinois: Charles C. Thomas, 1974., p. 971
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: 10% SOLN APPLIED TO CONJUNCTIVA CAUSES SLIGHT OR MILD REACTION, BUT PROLONGED APPLICATION HAS BEEN NOTED TO CAUSE DISCOLORATION.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Grant, W. M. Toxicology of the Eye. 2nd ed. Springfield, Illinois: Charles C. Thomas, 1974., p. 971
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: TESTS INVOLVING LOCAL INJECTION OR APPLICATION TO CORNEAS DENUDED OF EPITHELIUM HAVE INDICATED THAT TANNIC ACID CAN PPT PROTEINS IN STROMA OF RABBIT CORNEAS & CAN CAUSE SOME INJURY EVEN @ NEUTRAL OR SLIGHTLY ALKALINE PH.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clarke, E.G., and M. L. Clarke. Veterinary Toxicology. Baltimore, Maryland: The Williams and Wilkins Company, 1975., p. 314
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ...ABLE TO KILL COW BY DAILY ADMIN OF 50 G FOR 16 DAYS, ALTHOUGH 25 G DAILY FOR 28 DAYS FAILED TO PRODUCE TOXIC SYMPTOMS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clarke, E.G., and M. L. Clarke. Veterinary Toxicology. Baltimore, Maryland: The Williams and Wilkins Company, 1975., p. 173
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ADDED TO DIET OF CHICKS, TANNIC ACID @ LEVEL OF 0.5% CAUSES DEPRESSION OF GROWTH RATE, @ LEVEL OF 5.0%, 70% MORTALITY.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clarke, E.G., and M. L. Clarke. Veterinary Toxicology. Baltimore, Maryland: The Williams and Wilkins Company, 1975., p. 173
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ADMINISTERED ORALLY, IT CAUSES HEMORRHAGIC GASTRITIS IN RABBITS... IN HORSE, DOSES OF 50 TO 300 G GIVEN BY STOMACH TUBE CAUSE COLIC & JAUNDICE, WITH HEMOLYTIC ANEMIA, NECROSIS OF GASTRIC MUCOSA, DEGENERATION OF HEART MUSCLE, NEPHRITIS, & CHANGES IN LIVER.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 258
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ...ADMIN BY IP OR SC INJECTION TO RATS... SEQUENCE OF EVENTS WAS CONCN OF TANNIC ACID IN NUCLEI, INHIBITION OF NUCLEAR RNA SYNTHESIS, INHIBITION OF PROTEIN SYNTHESIS, & PRODUCTION OF NECROSIS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 258
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: NO LIVER DAMAGE WAS OBSERVED IN 7 MALE WISTAR RATS FED 60 MG/KG BODY WT/DAY TANNIC ACID (DAB.6) DURING 152 DAYS. SINGLE SC DOSE OF 250 MG/KG BODY WT TANNIC ACID TO RATS RESULTED IN CENTRILOBULAR NECROSIS OF LIVER; SIMILAR RESULTS WERE OBTAINED IN RABBITS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 257
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ...EXTRACTS PREPARED FROM PLANT MATERIALS...& TANNIC ACID (BP) WERE INJECTED SC IN GROUPS OF 10 AUGUST RATS @ DOSES OF 1 ML WEEKLY DURING 12 WK. ONE RAT INJECTED WITH QUEBRACHO EXTRACT & 1 INJECTED WITH MIMOSA EXTRACT DEVELOPED LOCAL SARCOMAS AFTER 1 YR.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 257
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: GROUP OF 14 MALE & 14 FEMALE WHITE RATS, 2-MO OLD, WAS INJECTED SC WITH AQ SOLN OF TANNIC ACID (USP) EVERY 5TH DAY FOR 290 DAYS (INITIAL DOSE, 150 MG/KG BODY WT; LATER, 200 MG/KG...) 23...SURVIVED 100 DAYS. ...AFTER 388 DAYS... 5/28...HAD HEPATOMAS & 6/28 HAD CHOLANGIOMAS. ...TUMORS OCCURRED RARELY IN UNTREATED RATS...

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 257
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ...EXTRACTS...FROM VARIOUS PLANT MATERIALS...& TANNIC ACID (BP) WERE INJECTED SC @ DOSE OF 0.25 ML IN STOCK MICE WEEKLY FOR 12 WK. AFTER 1 YR...CONDENSED TANNINS EVOKED LOCAL SARCOMAS & LIVER TUMORS &...HYDROLYZABLE TANNINS PRODUCED ONLY LIVER TUMORS. ... NO CONTROLS...

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Gosselin, R.E., H.C. Hodge, R.P. Smith, and M.N. Gleason. Clinical Toxicology of Commercial Products. 4th ed. Baltimore: Williams and Wilkins, 1976., p. II-166
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ACUTE ORAL...IN RATS... HIGHER DOSES PRODUCE RAPID DEMISE IN RESP FAILURE. PATHOLOGICAL FINDINGS INCLUDED GASTRITIS, HEPATIC NECROSIS (USUSAL CAUSE OF DEATH) & NEPHRITIS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V10 257
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: .../IN MALE & FEMALE WHITE RATS/ FOUR WEEKLY DOSES OF 200 OR 250 MG/KG BODY WT TANNIC ACID, INJECTED SC, ENHANCED HEPATOCARCINOGENIC EFFECT OF 2-ACETYLAMINOFLUORENE.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: PEASLEE MH ET AL; TANNIC ACID-INDUCED ALTERATIONS IN MOUSE GROWTH & PITUITARY MELANOCYTE-STIMULATING HORMONE ACTIVITY; TOXICOL APPL PHARMACOL 25: 507 (1973)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: MICE WITH LOWEST INITIAL WT (7-11.3 G) HAD CONTINUED DEPRESSED GROWTH UNTIL AUTOPSY & EXIBITED SIGNIFICANT INCR IN PITUITARY ACTIVITY FROM DIET OF 5-8% TANNIC ACID.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: ELKIN RG ET AL; INFLUENCE OF SORGHUM GRAIN TANNINS OF METHIONINE UTILIZATION IN CHICKS; POULT SCI 57: 704 (1978)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: INFLUENCE OF SORGHUM GRAIN TANNINS ON METHIONINE UTILIZATION IN CHICKS STUDIED.
